article:
Carl Friedrich Gauss

Johann Carl Friedrich Gauss (April 30, 1777 – February 23, 1855) was a German mathematician and physicist who made significant contributions to many fields, including number theory, algebra, statistics, analysis, differential geometry, astronomy, and physics. He is considered one of the greatest mathematicians of all time, and his work had a profound impact on the development of modern mathematics and science.

# Biography

## Youth and education

Gauss was born in Braunschweig, in the Duchy of Brunswick (now part of Lower Saxony, Germany), to a poor family. His father, Gebhard Dietrich Gauss, was a gardener and a bricklayer, and his mother, Dorothea Benze, was a housemaid. Gauss's exceptional mathematical talents were recognized from an early age. At the age of three, he corrected his father's arithmetic calculations, and by the age of seven, he was performing complex calculations in his head.

Gauss attended the local elementary school and later the Martino-Katharineum, a secondary school in Braunschweig. In 1792, he entered the University of Göttingen, where he studied mathematics, physics, and philosophy. Gauss's academic career was marked by his exceptional mathematical abilities, and he quickly became known for his innovative solutions to mathematical problems.

## Private scholar

After completing his studies, Gauss returned to Braunschweig and lived as a private scholar, supported by his patron, the Duke of Brunswick. During this period, he worked on his famous book, "Disquisitiones Arithmeticae," which was published in 1801. This book laid the foundations for modern number theory and established Gauss as a leading mathematician of his time.

## Professor in Göttingen

In 1807, Gauss was appointed as the director of the astronomical observatory in Göttingen, a position he held until his death. He also became a professor of mathematics at the University of Göttingen, where he taught mathematics and astronomy. Gauss's lectures were highly regarded, and he attracted many students from all over Europe.

## Gauss's brain

After Gauss's death, his brain was preserved and studied by the German anatomist Rudolf Wagner. Wagner's study revealed that Gauss's brain had some unusual features, including a higher-than-average number of neurons and a more developed cerebral cortex. These findings have been interpreted as evidence of Gauss's exceptional cognitive abilities.

## Family

Gauss married Johanna Osthoff in 1805, and they had two sons, Joseph and Wilhelm. After Johanna's death in 1809, Gauss married Minna Waldeck in 1810, and they had three children together. Gauss's family life was marked by tragedy, including the death of his first wife and the loss of several children.

## Personality

Gauss was known for his exceptional intelligence, his passion for mathematics, and his perfectionism. He was a quiet and introverted person who preferred to work alone, but he was also known for his kindness and generosity towards his students and colleagues.

### Scholar

Gauss was a meticulous scholar who demanded the highest standards from himself and others. He was known for his attention to detail and his ability to spot errors in mathematical proofs. Gauss's approach to mathematics was characterized by his emphasis on rigor and his desire to understand the underlying principles of mathematical concepts.

### Private man

Gauss was a private person who kept his personal life separate from his public life. He was known to be kind and generous towards his family and friends, but he was also fiercely protective of his privacy. Gauss's personal life was marked by tragedy, including the loss of loved ones and the struggles of living with a disability.

# Scientific work

## Algebra and number theory

Gauss made significant contributions to algebra and number theory, including the development of the fundamental theorem of algebra and the proof of Fermat's Last Theorem for n=3.

### Fundamental theorem of algebra

Gauss's proof of the fundamental theorem of algebra, which states that every non-constant polynomial equation has at least one complex root, was a major milestone in the development of modern algebra.

### Disquisitiones Arithmeticae

Gauss's book, "Disquisitiones Arithmeticae," is considered one of the most important works in the history of number theory. The book introduces the concept of modular arithmetic and provides a systematic treatment of the properties of integers.

### Further investigations

Gauss continued to work on number theory throughout his life, making significant contributions to the study of prime numbers, quadratic forms, and elliptic curves.

## Analysis

Gauss made significant contributions to analysis, including the development of the concept of convergence and the proof of the fundamental theorem of calculus.

### Numeric analysis

Gauss's work on numeric analysis, including his development of the method of Gaussian elimination, laid the foundations for modern numerical analysis.

## Chronology

Gauss's work on chronology, including his study of the dates of ancient events, was an important contribution to the field of history.

## Astronomy

Gauss made significant contributions to astronomy, including the discovery of the asteroid Ceres and the development of the method of orbit determination.

## Theory of errors

Gauss's work on the theory of errors, including his development of the normal distribution, laid the foundations for modern statistics.

## Arc measurement and geodetic survey

Gauss's work on arc measurement and geodetic survey, including his development of the method of triangulation, was an important contribution to the field of geodesy.

## Differential geometry

Gauss's work on differential geometry, including his development of the concept of curvature, laid the foundations for modern differential geometry.

## Non-Euclidean geometry

Gauss's work on non-Euclidean geometry, including his development of the concept of hyperbolic space, was an important contribution to the field of geometry.

## Early topology

Gauss's work on early topology, including his study of the properties of surfaces, was an important contribution to the field of topology.

## Minor mathematical accomplishments

Gauss made many minor mathematical accomplishments throughout his life, including his work on the calculation of π and his development of the method of Gaussian quadrature.

## Magnetism and telegraphy

Gauss made significant contributions to the study of magnetism and telegraphy, including his development of the telegraph system.

### Geomagnetism

Gauss's work on geomagnetism, including his study of the Earth's magnetic field, was an important contribution to the field of geophysics.

### Electromagnetism

Gauss's work on electromagnetism, including his development of the concept of electromagnetic induction, laid the foundations for modern electromagnetism.

## Potential theory

Gauss's work on potential theory, including his development of the concept of potential energy, was an important contribution to the field of physics.

## Optics

Gauss's work on optics, including his study of the properties of lenses and mirrors, was an important contribution to the field of optics.

## Mechanics

Gauss's work on mechanics, including his development of the concept of force and energy, laid the foundations for modern mechanics.

## Metrology

Gauss's work on metrology, including his development of the method of measurement, was an important contribution to the field of physics.

# Anecdotes

Gauss was known for his sense of humor and his ability to find humor in mathematics. One famous anecdote tells the story of how Gauss, as a young student, was given a task by his teacher to add up the numbers from 1 to 100. Gauss quickly realized that the sum could be calculated using the formula n(n+1)/2, and he arrived at the answer in just a few minutes.

# Honours and awards

Gauss received many honors and awards during his lifetime, including the Copley Medal and the Pour le Mérite.

# Names and commemorations

Gauss's name is commemorated in many ways, including the gauss, a unit of measurement for magnetic fields, and the Gauss crater on the Moon.

article:
Lisa Marie Presley

Lisa Marie Presley (February 1, 1968 – January 12, 2023) was an American singer, songwriter, and heiress to the estate of her father, Elvis Presley. Born in Memphis, Tennessee, Lisa Marie Presley was the only child of Elvis and Priscilla Presley. She began her music career in the early 2000s, releasing her debut album "To Whom It May Concern" in 2003. Throughout her life, Presley was also known for her philanthropic efforts, particularly in the area of music education.

#Early life

Lisa Marie Presley was born on February 1, 1968, at Baptist Memorial Hospital in Memphis, Tennessee. She was the only child of Elvis Presley and his wife, Priscilla Presley. Lisa Marie's parents divorced in 1973, and she spent her childhood shuttling between her parents' homes in Memphis and Los Angeles. Her father, Elvis Presley, was a legendary musician and performer, often referred to as the "King of Rock and Roll." Lisa Marie's early life was marked by the intense media scrutiny and public attention that came with being the daughter of a famous parent.

#Career

Lisa Marie Presley's music career spanned over two decades, during which she released three studio albums and several singles.

##2003–2005: To Whom It May Concern

Lisa Marie Presley's debut album, "To Whom It May Concern," was released on April 8, 2003. The album was produced by Eric Rosse and featured the singles "Lights Out" and "Sinking In." "To Whom It May Concern" received generally positive reviews from music critics, with many praising Presley's unique vocal style and songwriting abilities. The album peaked at number 5 on the US Billboard 200 chart and was certified gold by the RIAA.

##2005–2012: Now What and further singles

Presley's second album, "Now What," was released on April 5, 2005. The album was produced by Glen Ballard and featured the singles "Dirty Laundry" and "Idiot." "Now What" received mixed reviews from music critics, with some praising Presley's vocal performance and others criticizing the album's production and songwriting. The album peaked at number 9 on the US Billboard 200 chart.

In the years following the release of "Now What," Presley released several singles, including "In the Ghetto" and "You Ain't Seen Nothin' Yet." She also made appearances on various television shows, including "American Idol" and "The Oprah Winfrey Show."

##2012–2018: Storm & Grace and final releases

Presley's third and final studio album, "Storm & Grace," was released on May 15, 2012. The album was produced by T-Bone Burnett and featured the singles "You Ain't Seen Nothin' Yet" and "Over Me." "Storm & Grace" received generally positive reviews from music critics, with many praising Presley's vocal performance and the album's stripped-down production.

In the years following the release of "Storm & Grace," Presley released several singles, including "I Love You Because" and "Where No One Stands Alone." She also made appearances on various television shows, including "The Tonight Show with Jimmy Fallon" and "Good Morning America."

##Memoir

In 2020, Presley announced that she was working on a memoir, which would detail her life, career, and experiences as the daughter of Elvis Presley. However, the memoir was not completed before her death in 2023.

#Charity work and humanitarian efforts

Lisa Marie Presley was involved in various philanthropic efforts throughout her life, particularly in the area of music education.

##Grammy Foundation

Presley was a long-time supporter of the Grammy Foundation, which provides music education programs and resources to schools and communities. She appeared at several Grammy Foundation events, including the annual Grammy Foundation Gala, and donated to the organization's music education initiatives.

#Awards and honors

Throughout her career, Presley received several awards and honors for her music and philanthropic efforts. These include:

* 2003: Nominated for a MTV Video Music Award for Best New Artist in a Video for "Lights Out"
* 2005: Won a American Music Award for Favorite Pop/Rock Female Artist
* 2012: Won a Grammy Award for Best Americana Album for "Storm & Grace"

#Personal life

Lisa Marie Presley's personal life was marked by several high-profile marriages and divorces, as well as her involvement in the Church of Scientology.

##Marriages and divorces

Presley was married four times:

* Danny Keough (married 1988-1994)
* Michael Jackson (married 1994-1996)
* Nicolas Cage (married 2002-2004)
* Michael Lockwood (married 2006-2021)

##Scientology

Presley was a member of the Church of Scientology from the 1990s until her death in 2023. She credited the church with helping her overcome personal struggles and addiction.

#Elvis Presley estate

As the only child of Elvis Presley, Lisa Marie Presley inherited her father's estate, which includes his music catalog, publishing company, and various other assets.

##"Elvis Through His Daughter's Eyes" exhibit

In 2012, Presley curated an exhibit at the Graceland estate, titled "Elvis Through His Daughter's Eyes." The exhibit featured personal artifacts and mementos from Presley's childhood, as well as rare photographs and memorabilia from her father's career.

##Aircraft Lisa Marie

The "Lisa Marie" is a custom-built aircraft that was owned by Elvis Presley and is now part of the Graceland estate. The aircraft was restored and refurbished by Presley and is on display at Graceland.

#Death

Lisa Marie Presley died on January 12, 2023, at the age of 54, after suffering a cardiac arrest at her home in Calabasas, California.

2023 MTV Video Music Awards

The 2023 MTV Video Music Awards were held on September 12, 2023, at the Prudential Center in Newark, New Jersey. The ceremony recognized the best in music videos released between June 2022 and June 2023. The event was broadcast live on MTV, and was also made available to stream on the network's website and app.

# Performances

The 2023 MTV Video Music Awards featured a variety of performances from some of the biggest names in music.

## Pre-show

article:
Donald Trump is the 45th President of the United States, serving from 2017 to 2021. Before entering politics, he was a businessman and television personality. Trump's presidency was marked by controversy, scandals, and significant policy changes. This article provides an overview of his life, business career, media career, and presidency.

#Personal life

##Early life
Donald John Trump was born on June 14, 1946, in Queens, New York, to Mary Anne MacLeod and Frederick Christ Trump. He was the fourth of five children. Trump's father was a successful real estate developer, and the family lived a comfortable life. Trump attended the New York Military Academy and later studied at Fordham University and the University of Pennsylvania.

##Family
Trump married Ivana Zelníčková in 1977, and they had three children: Donald Jr., Ivanka, and Eric. The couple divorced in 1992. In 1993, Trump married Marla Maples, with whom he had a daughter, Tiffany. They divorced in 1999. In 2005, Trump married Melania Knauss, a former model. They have one son, Barron.

##Religion
Trump was raised Presbyterian and has stated that he is a Christian. However, his religious views have been subject to controversy, and some have questioned his commitment to Christianity.

##Health habits
Trump has been known for his unconventional health habits, including a diet of fast food and limited exercise. In 2016, his doctor released a letter stating that Trump was in good health, but some experts raised concerns about the letter's accuracy.

##Wealth
Trump's net worth is estimated to be around $3.1 billion, according to Forbes. His wealth comes from a variety of sources, including real estate, licensing deals, and investments.

#Business career

##Real estate
Trump's business career began in real estate, where he worked for his father's company, the Trump Organization. He eventually took over the company and expanded its operations to include luxury hotels, casinos, and golf courses.

###Manhattan and Chicago developments
Trump's most notable real estate developments include the Trump Tower in Manhattan and the Trump International Hotel and Tower in Chicago. He also developed several other properties in Manhattan, including the Trump Plaza and the Trump Palace.

###Atlantic City casinos
In the 1980s, Trump expanded his business to Atlantic City, where he built several casinos, including the Trump Taj Mahal and the Trump Plaza Hotel and Casino.

###Clubs
Trump also owns several private clubs, including the Mar-a-Lago resort in Palm Beach, Florida, and the Trump National Doral in Miami.

##Licensing of the Trump brand
Trump has licensed his brand to various companies, which have used it to sell a range of products, including clothing, home goods, and food.

##Side ventures
Trump has also invested in various side ventures, including a line of steaks, a water company, and a magazine.

###Trump University
In 2005, Trump founded Trump University, which offered real estate and business courses. The university was shut down in 2010 after several lawsuits were filed against it.

##Foundation
The Donald J. Trump Foundation was established in 1987 to support various charitable causes. However, the foundation has been subject to controversy, and some have accused Trump of using it to promote his own interests.

##Legal affairs and bankruptcies
Trump has been involved in several high-profile lawsuits and bankruptcies throughout his career. In 1990, he filed for bankruptcy after his Atlantic City casinos struggled financially. He also filed for bankruptcy in 2004 and 2009.

#Media career

##Books
Trump has written several books, including "The Art of the Deal" and "Great Again: How to Fix Our Crippled America."

##Film and television
Trump has appeared in several films and television shows, including "The Apprentice" and "The Celebrity Apprentice." He also made a cameo appearance in the film "Home Alone 2: Lost in New York."

#Political career

##Presidential campaigns (2000–2016)

###2016 presidential campaign
Trump announced his candidacy for the 2016 presidential election in June 2015. His campaign was marked by controversy and scandal, but he ultimately won the Republican nomination.

####Campaign rhetoric and political positions
Trump's campaign rhetoric was characterized by his populist and nationalist views. He promised to build a wall along the US-Mexico border, restrict immigration, and create jobs.

####Financial disclosures
Trump's financial disclosures revealed that he had a significant amount of debt and had paid relatively little in taxes.

####Election to the presidency
Trump won the presidential election on November 8, 2016, defeating Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton.

#Presidency (2017–2021)

##Early actions
Trump's presidency was marked by controversy and scandal from the start. He issued an executive order banning travel from several predominantly Muslim countries, which was met with widespread protests.

##Conflicts of interest
Trump's presidency was also marked by conflicts of interest, as he refused to divest from his business empire.

##Domestic policy

###Economy
Trump's economic policies included tax cuts and deregulation. He also imposed tariffs on several countries, including China and Canada.

###Climate change, environment, and energy
Trump withdrew the US from the Paris Climate Agreement and rolled back several environmental regulations.

###Deregulation
Trump's administration rolled back several regulations, including those related to healthcare and finance.

###Health care
Trump attempted to repeal the Affordable Care Act, but was unsuccessful.

###Social issues
Trump's administration took a hardline stance on social issues, including immigration and LGBTQ+ rights.

##Pardons and commutations
Trump issued several pardons and commutations during his presidency, including one for former Sheriff Joe Arpaio.

##Immigration

###Travel ban
Trump's travel ban was met with widespread protests and was eventually upheld by the Supreme Court.

###Family separation at the border
Trump's administration implemented a policy of separating families at the border, which was widely criticized.

###Trump wall and government shutdown
Trump's demand for funding for a border wall led to a government shutdown in 2018.

##Foreign policy

###Trade
Trump's trade policies included tariffs on several countries and the renegotiation of several trade agreements.

###Russia
Trump's relationship with Russia was subject to controversy, particularly with regards to allegations of election interference.

###China
Trump's administration took a hardline stance on China, including imposing tariffs and accusing the country of intellectual property theft.

###North Korea
Trump met with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un in 2018, but the meeting was met with skepticism by many experts.

###Afghanistan
Trump's administration continued to military involvement in Afghanistan, despite his campaign promises to withdraw.

###Israel
Trump's administration moved the US embassy to Jerusalem and recognized Israel's sovereignty over the Golan Heights.

###Saudi Arabia
Trump's administration maintained close ties with Saudi Arabia, despite criticism over the country's human rights record.

###Syria
Trump's administration launched several airstrikes against Syria, including one in response to a chemical attack.

###Iran
Trump's administration took a hardline stance on Iran, including withdrawing from the Iran nuclear deal and imposing sanctions.

##Personnel
Trump's administration was marked by high turnover, with several prominent officials resigning or being fired.

##Judiciary
Trump's administration appointed several conservative judges to the federal judiciary, including two Supreme Court justices.

##COVID-19 pandemic

###Initial response
Trump's administration was criticized for its slow response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

###White House Coronavirus Task Force
Trump established the White House Coronavirus Task Force in January 2020, which was led by Vice President Mike Pence.

###World Health Organization
Trump's administration announced that it would withdraw from the World Health Organization in 2020.

###Pressure to abandon pandemic mitigation measures
Trump faced pressure from some of his supporters to abandon pandemic mitigation measures, such as mask-wearing and social distancing.

###Political pressure on health agencies
Trump's administration faced criticism for putting political pressure on health agencies, such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

###Outbreak at the White House
Several members of Trump's administration, including the President himself, contracted COVID-19 in 2020.

###Effects on the 2020 presidential campaign
The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the 2020 presidential campaign, with several events and rallies being cancelled or postponed.

##Investigations

###Russian election interference
Trump's administration was investigated for its role in Russian election interference, including the Mueller investigation.

###FBI Crossfire Hurricane and 2017 counterintelligence investigations
The FBI launched several investigations into Trump's administration, including Crossfire Hurricane and a 2017 counterintelligence investigation.

###Mueller investigation
The Mueller investigation found that Russia had interfered in the 2016 presidential election, but did not establish that Trump's campaign had colluded with Russia.

##First impeachment

###Impeachment trial in the Senate
Trump was acquitted by the Senate in 2020, after being impeached by the House of Representatives on charges of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress.

##2020 presidential campaign

##2020 presidential election

###False claims of voting fraud, attempt to prevent presidential transition
Trump made several false claims of voting fraud and attempted to prevent the presidential transition, but was ultimately unsuccessful.

###Concern about a possible coup attempt or military action
There were concerns about a possible coup attempt or military action, but these ultimately did not materialize.

###January 6 Capitol attack
A mob of Trump supporters stormed the US Capitol on January 6, 2021, in an attempt to overturn the results of the presidential election.

###Second impeachment
Trump was impeached by the House of Representatives for a second time, on charges of inciting an insurrection.

#Post-presidency (2021–present)

##Business activities

##Investigations, criminal indictments and convictions, civil lawsuits

###FBI investigations
The FBI continued to investigate Trump's administration, including his handling of classified documents.

###Criminal referral by the House January 6 Committee
The House January 6 Committee referred Trump to the Justice Department for potential criminal prosecution.

###Federal and state criminal indictments
Trump was indicted by a federal grand jury in 2023 on charges related to his handling of classified documents.

###Criminal conviction in the 2016 campaign fraud case
Trump was convicted in 2023 of campaign finance fraud related to the 2016 presidential election.

###Civil judgments against Trump
Trump was ordered to pay several civil judgments, including one related to his handling of the Trump Foundation.

##2024 presidential campaign

#Public image

##Scholarly assessment and public approval surveys

2023 Taipei Open

The 2023 Taipei Open was a professional badminton tournament that took place in Taipei, Taiwan, from September 5 to September 10, 2023. The tournament was part of the 2023 BWF World Tour and was sanctioned by the Badminton World Federation (BWF).

# Tournament

## Venue

The tournament was held at the Taipei Gymnasium in Taipei, Taiwan. The venue has a seating capacity of 7,000 and has hosted several major badminton tournaments in the past.

## Point distribution

The tournament was classified as a Super 300 event, which meant that the winners of each discipline received 7,000 points towards their BWF ranking. The points distribution was as follows:

* Winner: 7,000 points
* Runner-up: 5,950 points
* Semi-finalists: 4,900 points
* Quarter-finalists: 3,850 points
* Round of 16: 2,800 points
* Round of 32: 1,750 points
* Round of 64: 1,050 points

## Prize pool

The total prize pool for the tournament was $500,000, with the winners of each discipline receiving $33,750.

The top seeds in the men's singles discipline were:

1.  Lee Zii Jia (Malaysia)

5.  Ng Ka Long (Hong Kong)

article:
Jawan (film)
================

Jawan is an upcoming Indian Hindi-language action thriller film directed by Atlee and produced by Gauri Khan and Gaurav Verma under the banners of Red Chillies Entertainment and Hope Productions. The film stars Shah Rukh Khan, Nayanthara, and Vijay Sethupathi in the lead roles. Jawan is scheduled for release on June 2, 2023.

Plot
-----

The film's plot is centered around a mysterious figure who sets out to avenge the injustices faced by the common people. The story follows a complex web of events and characters, leading to a thrilling climax. The film's narrative is full of twists and turns, keeping the audience engaged and invested in the story.

Cast
-----

* Shah Rukh Khan as Vikram Rathod, a mysterious figure on a mission to avenge the injustices faced by the common people.
* Nayanthara as Nalini, a strong and independent woman who becomes entangled in Vikram's mission.
* Vijay Sethupathi as Rajan, a powerful and ruthless adversary who stands in Vikram's way.

Production
-----------

### Development

The film was first announced in June 2021, with Atlee directing and Shah Rukh Khan starring in the lead role. The project was initially titled "Lion" but was later changed to Jawan. The film's script was written by Atlee, S. Ramana Girivasan, and K. P. Selvah.

### Casting

Shah Rukh Khan was the first actor to be cast in the film. Nayanthara was later cast as the female lead, marking her Bollywood debut. Vijay Sethupathi was cast as the main antagonist, making his Bollywood debut as well.

### Filming

Principal photography for the film began in September 2021 and wrapped up in January 2023. The film was shot in various locations, including Mumbai, Hyderabad, and Dubai.

### Post-production

The film's post-production work began in February 2023 and is currently underway. The film's editing is being handled by Ruben, while the cinematography is being handled by Vishnu Sarma.

Themes and influences
----------------------

Jawan explores themes of justice, power, and corruption. The film's narrative is influenced by real-life events and draws inspiration from various sources, including literature and history. The film's action sequences are inspired by Hollywood blockbusters, while the film's emotional moments are inspired by Indian cinema.

Music

Marketing
----------

The film's marketing campaign began in February 2023, with the release of the film's first poster. The film's trailer was released on April 15, 2023, and has since become the most-viewed trailer in Indian cinema history. The film's promotions are being handled by Red Chillies Entertainment and Hope Productions.

Release

### Theatrical

### Home media

Accolades
----------

The film has not yet been released, but it is expected to receive several awards and nominations. The film's action sequences and Shah Rukh Khan's performance are expected to be recognized by several award-giving bodies.

Future
-------

The film's success is expected to pave the way for a sequel, which is already in the works. The film's director, Atlee, has expressed interest in making a sequel, and the film's cast is expected to reprise their roles.

Notes

article:
Liga 1 (Indonesia)
================

Liga 1 is the top professional football league in Indonesia, founded in 1994. It is the country's primary football competition, and it is contested by 18 clubs. The league is operated by the Football Association of Indonesia (PSSI) and is currently sponsored by Shopee.

History
--------

### Origins

The concept of a top-flight football league in Indonesia dates back to the 1930s, when the country was still a Dutch colony. The first national football competition, the Perserikatan, was established in 1930. However, this competition was not a professional league, and it was mainly contested by amateur teams.

### Foundation

In 1979, the PSSI introduced the Galatama, a semi-professional league that was the precursor to the modern-day Liga 1. The Galatama was contested by teams from various regions in Indonesia, and it was the first national football competition to feature teams from outside Java.

### Dualism

In 1990, the PSSI introduced the Liga Indonesia, which was the country's first professional football league. However, the Liga Indonesia was not the only top-flight competition in Indonesia at that time. The Perserikatan, which was still contested by amateur teams, continued to exist alongside the Liga Indonesia. This led to a period of dualism in Indonesian football, with two separate competitions running concurrently.

### Government intervention and FIFA suspension

In 2015, the Indonesian government intervened in the country's football affairs, leading to a crisis that resulted in the suspension of the PSSI by FIFA. The government's intervention led to the establishment of a rival league, the Indonesia Super League (ISL), which was not recognized by FIFA. The ISL was eventually disbanded, and the PSSI was reinstated by FIFA in 2016.

### Name change

In 2017, the PSSI announced that the top-flight league would be rebranded as Liga 1, replacing the Indonesia Super League (ISL) name. The name change was intended to signal a new era in Indonesian football, with a focus on improving the league's competitiveness and professionalism.

Competition format
-----------------

### Competition

Liga 1 is contested by 18 teams, with each team playing the others twice (home and away) during the regular season. The team with the most points at the end of the regular season is crowned the champion.

### Promotion and relegation

The bottom three teams in Liga 1 are relegated to Liga 2, the country's second-tier competition. The top three teams in Liga 2 are promoted to Liga 1 for the following season.

### Video assistant referee

Liga 1 introduced the video assistant referee (VAR) system in 2020, becoming the first league in Southeast Asia to do so. The VAR system is used to assist referees in making decisions on goals, penalties, and direct red cards.

article:
Oppenheimer (film)

Oppenheimer is an upcoming biographical drama film written and directed by Christopher Nolan. The film is based on the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer, the director of the Manhattan Project, which developed the atomic bomb during World War II. The film is set to be released in 2023 and stars Cillian Murphy as Oppenheimer.

#Plot

The film is a biographical drama that tells the story of J. Robert Oppenheimer, a brilliant physicist who was tasked with leading the Manhattan Project, a secret research and development project that produced the atomic bomb during World War II. The film explores Oppenheimer's personal and professional life, including his relationships with his wife Kitty and his colleagues, as well as his struggles with the moral implications of the bomb.

The film is based on the Pulitzer Prize-winning biography "American Prometheus: The Triumph and Tragedy of J. Robert Oppenheimer" by Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin. The book provides a detailed account of Oppenheimer's life, from his childhood to his later years, and explores the complexities of his personality and the impact of his work on the world.

#Cast

* Cillian Murphy as J. Robert Oppenheimer
* Emily Blunt as Kitty Oppenheimer
* Matt Damon as Leslie Groves
* Robert Downey Jr. as Lewis Strauss
* Florence Pugh as Jean Tatlock
* Rami Malek as Lyndon B. Johnson
* Benny Safdie as Edward Teller
* Josh Hartnett as Ernest Lawrence
* Dane DeHaan as Kenneth Nichols
* Alden Ehrenreich as unknown

#Production

##Development

The film was first announced in 2015, when Christopher Nolan revealed that he was working on a script about the life of J. Robert Oppenheimer. Nolan had been fascinated by Oppenheimer's story for many years and had been researching the subject for several years before beginning work on the script.

In 2020, it was announced that Cillian Murphy had been cast as Oppenheimer, and that the film would be produced by Nolan's production company, Syncopy, in association with Universal Pictures.

##Writing

The script for Oppenheimer was written by Christopher Nolan, who is known for his complex and layered storytelling style. Nolan worked closely with the authors of the biography, Kai Bird and Martin J. Sherwin, to ensure that the film was accurate and true to the spirit of Oppenheimer's life.

The script is based on extensive research into Oppenheimer's life, including his personal letters and diaries, as well as interviews with people who knew him. Nolan also drew on his own interests in physics and philosophy to explore the deeper themes of the film.

##Casting

The cast of Oppenheimer includes a number of well-known actors, including Cillian Murphy, Emily Blunt, and Matt Damon. The actors underwent extensive research and preparation to get into character, including reading the biography and other books about Oppenheimer's life.

Cillian Murphy, who plays Oppenheimer, is a highly acclaimed actor known for his intense preparation and immersion into his roles. He spent several months researching Oppenheimer's life and working with Nolan to develop the character.

##Filming

Principal photography for Oppenheimer began in February 2022 and lasted for several months. The film was shot on location in the United States, including in New Mexico and California.

The film's cinematographer, Hoyte van Hoytema, used a combination of digital and film cameras to capture the look and feel of the period. The film's production design, led by Nathan Crowley, aimed to recreate the look and feel of the 1940s and 1950s.

##Post-production

Post-production on Oppenheimer began in the summer of 2022 and lasted for several months. The film's editor, Jennifer Lame, worked closely with Nolan to shape the narrative and create a coherent and engaging film.

The film's visual effects, led by Andrew Jackson, aimed to recreate the look and feel of the atomic bomb tests and other complex sequences. The film's sound design, led by Richard King, aimed to create a immersive and realistic soundtrack.

#Music

article:
Federal Prosecution of Donald Trump (Classified Documents Case)

The federal prosecution of Donald Trump, the 45th President of the United States, relates to his alleged mishandling of classified documents. This case is one of several investigations and prosecutions involving Trump since his presidency. The case involves the unauthorized retention and concealment of classified documents at Trump's Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida, and the alleged obstruction of justice in the investigation that followed.

# Background

In January 2021, as Trump's presidency came to an end, the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) requested the return of presidential records from Trump's administration. In response, Trump returned 15 boxes of documents to NARA in January 2022. However, the agency later discovered that some of the documents were classified, and a subsequent review revealed that additional classified documents were still in Trump's possession.

In April 2022, the Department of Justice (DOJ) issued a subpoena to Trump for the return of all remaining classified documents. Trump's lawyers claimed that all documents had been returned, but in June 2022, the FBI executed a search warrant at Mar-a-Lago, recovering additional classified documents. The search warrant was obtained after the DOJ had evidence that Trump's lawyers had not been truthful about the existence of classified documents.

# Indictments and Arraignments

## Original Indictment

On June 8, 2023, a federal grand jury indicted Trump on 32 counts related to the mishandling of classified documents. The indictment alleged that Trump had willfully retained and concealed classified documents, and that he had obstructed justice by making false statements to investigators and attempting to intimidate witnesses.

## Superseding Indictment

On August 1, 2023, a superseding indictment was filed, adding 7 new counts to the original indictment. The superseding indictment included new allegations of obstruction of justice, including Trump's alleged attempts to influence the testimony of a witness.

## Assignment of District Judge

The case was assigned to District Judge Aileen Cannon, a Trump appointee. Judge Cannon's appointment to the case was met with criticism from some, who argued that her appointment by Trump created a conflict of interest.

## Arraignments

### Trump

Trump was arraigned on June 13, 2023, at the federal courthouse in Miami, Florida. During the arraignment, Trump pleaded not guilty to all charges.

### Nauta

Waltine Nauta, a Trump aide, was also arraigned on June 13, 2023. Nauta was charged with conspiracy to obstruct justice and making false statements to investigators.

### De Oliveira

Carlos De Oliveira, a Trump employee, was arraigned on June 15, 2023. De Oliveira was charged with conspiracy to obstruct justice and making false statements to investigators.

# Pretrial Proceedings

## 2023

In the months following the indictment, the parties engaged in pretrial proceedings, including motions and discovery. Trump's lawyers filed several motions, including a motion to dismiss the indictment and a motion to delay the trial.

## 2024

In January 2024, Trump's lawyers filed a motion to indefinitely delay the trial, citing the upcoming presidential election. The motion argued that the trial would interfere with Trump's ability to campaign and would create an unfair advantage for his opponents.

### Trump's Request to Indefinitely Delay Trial

The motion to delay the trial was met with opposition from the DOJ, which argued that the trial should proceed as scheduled. The DOJ argued that Trump's request was an attempt to use the trial as a political issue, and that the trial should not be delayed simply because of the upcoming election.

# Dismissal and Appeal

On February 10, 2024, Judge Cannon granted Trump's motion to dismiss the indictment. The dismissal was met with widespread criticism, with many arguing that the dismissal was a miscarriage of justice.

The DOJ appealed the dismissal to the 11th Circuit Court of Appeals. The appeal argued that Judge Cannon had erred in dismissing the indictment, and that the trial should proceed as scheduled.

# Response

## To Indictment

### Trump

Trump responded to the indictment by denying all allegations and attacking the DOJ and the FBI. Trump claimed that the indictment was a "witch hunt" and that he was being persecuted for political reasons.

### Other Republicans

Many Republicans came to Trump's defense, attacking the DOJ and the FBI for what they saw as a partisan prosecution. Some Republicans argued that the indictment was an attempt to interfere with the 2024 presidential election.

### Democrats

Democrats responded to the indictment by calling for Trump to be held accountable for his actions. Many Democrats argued that the indictment was a necessary step in ensuring that Trump was held accountable for his alleged crimes.

## To Dismissal

The dismissal of the indictment was met with widespread criticism from Democrats and many legal experts. Many argued that the dismissal was a miscarriage of justice, and that Trump had been given special treatment because of his status as a former president.

article:
Jimmy Buffett

James William Buffett is an American singer, songwriter, musician, author, actor, and businessman. He is best known for his island-inspired music, often incorporating elements of rock, country, and tropical music. With a career spanning over five decades, Buffett has become a cultural icon, appealing to a wide range of audiences with his unique sound and laid-back style.

#Early life

Jimmy Buffett was born on December 25, 1946, in Pascagoula, Mississippi. He grew up in Mobile, Alabama, where he developed a love for music at an early age. Buffett's parents, James Delaney Buffett Jr. and Mary Lorraine Peets, exposed him to a variety of music, including country, folk, and rock. He began playing the guitar at the age of 14 and formed his first band, The Upstairs Alliance, while attending high school.

After graduating from the University of Southern Mississippi in 1969, Buffett moved to Nashville, Tennessee, to pursue a career in music. He worked as a songwriter and demo singer, eventually landing a job with a publishing company. However, it was not until he moved to Key West, Florida, in the early 1970s that Buffett's music career began to take off.

#Music career

Buffett's music career spans over 50 years and includes numerous albums, singles, and collaborations. He is known for his unique blend of rock, country, and tropical music, often incorporating elements of folk, blues, and calypso.

##Musical style

Buffett's musical style is characterized by his laid-back, beach-inspired sound. His songs often feature catchy melodies, simple harmonies, and lyrics that reflect his love of the ocean, sailing, and island culture. Buffett's music has been influenced by a range of artists, including Bob Dylan, Hank Williams, and Harry Belafonte.

##Musical legacy

Buffett's music has had a significant impact on popular culture, inspiring a devoted fan base and influencing a range of artists, including Kenny Chesney, Alan Jackson, and Zac Brown. He has released over 30 studio albums, including "A White Sport Coat and a Pink Crustacean," "Living and Dying in 3/4 Time," and "Son of a Son of a Sailor." Buffett's music has also been featured in numerous films, television shows, and commercials.

##"Parrot Head" fans

Buffett's fans are affectionately known as "Parrot Heads." The term originated in the 1980s, when Buffett's fans began wearing Hawaiian shirts and parrot-themed accessories to his concerts. Today, the Parrot Head community is a global phenomenon, with thousands of fans attending Buffett's concerts and participating in charity events and fan conventions.

#Writing

In addition to his music, Buffett has written several books, including "The Jolly Mon," "Tales from Margaritaville," and "Swine Not?" His writing often reflects his love of sailing, island culture, and adventure, and has been praised for its humor, wit, and insight.

#Film and television

Buffett has appeared in numerous films and television shows, including "FM," "Urban Cowboy," and "Hawaii Five-0." He has also provided music for several soundtracks, including "Cocktail" and "The Beach Boys: An American Family."

##Soundtracks

Buffett's music has been featured in several soundtracks, including "Cocktail," "The Beach Boys: An American Family," and "Fast Times at Ridgemont High." His songs have also been featured in numerous television shows, including "The Simpsons," "Friends," and " Saturday Night Live."

##Cameo appearances

Buffett has made numerous cameo appearances in films and television shows, including "Urban Cowboy," "Hawaii Five-0," and "Jurassic World." He has also appeared in several documentaries, including "The Beach Boys: An American Family" and "Jimmy Buffett: A Son of a Son of a Sailor."

#Theatre

Buffett has also been involved in several theatrical productions, including the musical "Escape to Margaritaville," which premiered in 2017. The show features Buffett's music and a book by Greg Garcia and Mike O'Malley.

#Business ventures

In addition to his music and writing, Buffett has launched several business ventures, including restaurants, record labels, and beer.

##Restaurants

Buffett's restaurant chain, Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville, was launched in 1987 and has since expanded to include over 30 locations worldwide. The restaurants feature a range of menu items, including burgers, sandwiches, and seafood, as well as a selection of margaritas and other cocktails.

##Record labels

Buffett has launched several record labels, including Mailboat Records and Margaritaville Records. The labels have released music by Buffett and other artists, including The Beach Boys and The Neville Brothers.

##Beer

Buffett has launched several beer brands, including LandShark Lager and Margaritaville Brewing Company. The beers are available in several states and have been praised for their unique flavors and packaging.

##Casinos

Buffett has partnered with several casinos, including the Margaritaville Casino in Biloxi, Mississippi, and the Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville Casino in Bossier City, Louisiana. The casinos feature a range of games, including slots, table games, and poker, as well as several restaurants and bars.

##Sports

Buffett has been involved in several sports-related ventures, including the Margaritaville Cycling Team and the Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville Running Team. He has also partnered with several sports brands, including the NFL and the PGA Tour.

##Video games

Buffett has appeared in several video games, including "Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville Online" and "Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville: The Game." The games feature Buffett's music and allow players to explore virtual versions of his restaurants and other locations.

##Retirement communities

Buffett has partnered with several retirement communities, including Latitude Margaritaville and Margaritaville Retirement Community. The communities feature a range of amenities, including golf courses, swimming pools, and restaurants, as well as several Margaritaville-themed amenities.

##Cannabis

Buffett has launched a cannabis brand, Coral Reefer, which offers a range of products, including flower, concentrates, and edibles. The brand is available in several states and has been praised for its unique flavors and packaging.

##Berkshire Hathaway

Buffett is a longtime friend and admirer of Warren Buffett, the billionaire investor and CEO of Berkshire Hathaway. The two Buffetts have partnered on several ventures, including a line of Margaritaville-themed furniture and a chain of restaurants.

#Charity work

Buffett has been involved in numerous charity efforts throughout his career, including environmental conservation, disaster relief, and children's charities.

##Environmental conservation

Buffett has been a longtime advocate for environmental conservation, particularly in the Gulf of Mexico and the Caribbean. He has partnered with several organizations, including the Ocean Conservancy and the World Wildlife Fund, to support conservation efforts and promote sustainable fishing practices.

##Charity performances

Buffett has performed at numerous charity events, including the "One Love Manchester" benefit concert and the "Country Rising" benefit concert. He has also performed at several charity golf tournaments, including the "Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville Golf Tournament."

##Disaster relief

Buffett has been involved in several disaster relief efforts, including the "Hurricane Katrina Relief" effort and the "Hurricane Irma Relief" effort. He has also partnered with several organizations, including the American Red Cross and the Salvation Army, to support disaster relief efforts.

#Personal life

Buffett has been married three times and has three children. He is a longtime resident of Palm Beach, Florida, and has also lived in Key West, Florida, and Nashville, Tennessee.

##Illness and death

Buffett has been open about his struggles with health issues, including a 2015 bout with sepsis and a 2019 diagnosis of lymphoma. However, he has continued to tour and perform, and has shown no signs of slowing down.

article:
Open-source video game
=====================

An open-source video game is a video game whose source code is made available to the public, allowing anyone to modify and distribute the game. This approach to game development has gained popularity over the years, with many successful games being released under open-source licenses.

Definition and differentiation
-----------------------------

Open-source video games are often confused with freeware games, which are games that are available for free but do not provide access to their source code. Open-source games, on the other hand, provide the source code, allowing users to modify and customize the game to their liking. This differentiation is important, as it highlights the unique aspect of open-source games.

Background
----------

The concept of open-source software has been around for decades, with the first open-source licenses being developed in the 1980s. However, it wasn't until the 1990s that open-source software started to gain popularity, with the release of the Linux operating system. The success of Linux paved the way for other open-source projects, including video games.

History
-------

### Beginnings and early games

The first open-source video games were simple text-based games, such as adventure games and interactive fiction. These games were often created by hobbyists and shared on online communities, such as bulletin board systems (BBSs) and online forums. One of the earliest open-source games is the 1970s game "Colossal Cave Adventure," which was later released under an open-source license.

In the 1980s and 1990s, open-source games started to become more complex, with the release of games such as "NetHack" and "ADOM." These games were still text-based but featured more advanced gameplay mechanics and storytelling.

### 3D games and source releases

The 1990s saw the release of the first 3D open-source games, such as "Quake" and "Doom." These games were initially released as proprietary software but were later released under open-source licenses. The source code for these games allowed developers to create custom levels, models, and game modes.

The release of 3D game engines such as "id Tech 3" and "Doom 3" further accelerated the development of open-source games. These engines provided a foundation for developers to create their own 3D games, and many open-source games were built using these engines.

### Rise in popularity and diversity

In the 2000s, open-source games started to gain more popularity, with the release of games such as "World of Goo" and "Braid." These games were critically acclaimed and commercially successful, demonstrating that open-source games could be both fun and profitable.

The rise of digital distribution platforms such as Steam and GOG.com also made it easier for open-source games to reach a wider audience. Many open-source games were released on these platforms, and some even became best-sellers.

### Greater organization

As the open-source game community grew, there was a need for greater organization and coordination. This led to the formation of organizations such as the Open Source Game Alliance (OSGA) and the Free Software Foundation (FSF).

These organizations provided resources and support for open-source game developers, including documentation, tutorials, and community forums. They also helped to promote open-source games and advocate for the benefits of open-source game development.

### Hubs and development teams

The open-source game community has also given rise to hubs and development teams. These teams are often formed around a specific game or game engine and provide a way for developers to collaborate and share resources.

Examples of open-source game hubs include the "Unreal Engine" community and the "Godot Engine" community. These communities provide a wealth of resources, including tutorials, documentation, and community forums.

See also
--------

* Open-source software
* Free and open-source software
* List of open-source video games
* Open-source game engine

References
----------

External links
--------------

article:
Tsumyoki
================

Tsumyoki is a Japanese musician and producer who has gained widespread recognition for his unique blend of traditional Japanese music and modern electronic elements. Born and raised in Tokyo, Japan, Tsumyoki's music often incorporates elements of Japanese folklore and mythology, setting him apart from other electronic artists. With a career spanning just over a decade, Tsumyoki has established himself as a leading figure in the Japanese electronic music scene.

Early Life
-----------

Tsumyoki was born in 1992 in Tokyo, Japan. Growing up in a family of musicians, he was exposed to a wide range of traditional Japanese music from a young age. His parents, both skilled shamisen players, encouraged his interest in music and provided him with formal training in traditional Japanese instruments. Tsumyoki's early life was marked by a deep appreciation for Japanese culture and a fascination with the country's rich musical heritage.

Career
--------

### 2018–2019: Early Beginnings

Tsumyoki's music career began in 2018, when he started producing electronic music in his home studio. Initially, his music was heavily influenced by Western electronic artists, but he soon found himself drawn to incorporating traditional Japanese elements into his sound. During this period, Tsumyoki released several singles and EPs on independent labels, which garnered moderate attention from local music fans.

### 2019–present: Rise to Success

In 2019, Tsumyoki's music career took a significant turn with the release of his debut album, "Kokoro no Koe" (Voice of the Heart). The album, which featured a unique blend of traditional Japanese instruments and modern electronic production, received widespread critical acclaim and established Tsumyoki as a rising star in the Japanese electronic music scene. The album's success was followed by a string of high-profile live performances, including appearances at major music festivals in Japan.

Goa Trap Culture
-----------------

Tsumyoki's music is often associated with the Goa Trap culture, a subgenre of electronic music that originated in the 1990s. Goa Trap is characterized by its fast-paced rhythms, intricate melodies, and often, elements of traditional Indian and Japanese music. Tsumyoki's incorporation of traditional Japanese instruments and melodies into his music has been credited with helping to popularize the Goa Trap genre in Japan.

Discography
------------

### Albums

* "Kokoro no Koe" (Voice of the Heart) (2019)
* "Sakura no Ame" ( Cherry Blossom Rain) (2020)
* "Kaze no Michi" (Wind's Path) (2021)

### EPs

* "Yūgen" (Mysterious Sense of the Beauty of the World) (2018)
* "Kokoro no Niwa" (Garden of the Heart) (2019)
* "Hana no Koe" (Voice of the Flowers) (2020)

### Singles and Collaborations

* "Sakura" ( Cherry Blossom) (2018)
* "Kaze" (Wind) (2019)
* "Hana" (Flowers) (2020)
* "Kokoro" (Heart) (2021)
* "Tsuki" (Moon) (2021) (collaboration with Japanese musician, Kiyoshiro Imawano)

Awards and Nominations
----------------------

* Winner: Best New Artist, Japan Electronic Music Awards (2019)
* Nominee: Best Album, Japan Electronic Music Awards (2020)
* Winner: Best Live Performance, Japan Electronic Music Awards (2021)

Tours
------

* "Kaze no Michi" Tour (2021-2022)

Notes
-----

Tsumyoki's music is available on major streaming platforms, including Spotify, Apple Music, and YouTube Music. He is active on social media platforms, including Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook.

The 2022 Korea Masters was a badminton tournament that took place at the Gwangju Women's University Stadium in Gwangju, South Korea, from April 12 to April 17, 2022. The tournament was part of the 2022 BWF World Tour and was organized by the Badminton Korea Association.

# Tournament

The 2022 Korea Masters was held at the Gwangju Women's University Stadium in Gwangju, South Korea. The stadium has a seating capacity of 5,000 and features six badminton courts.

The 2022 Korea Masters was a Super 300 tournament, which means that it offered a higher number of ranking points compared to Super 100 and International Challenge tournaments. The point distribution for the tournament was as follows:

2023–24 Figure Skating Season

The 2023–24 figure skating season began on July 1, 2023, and will end on June 30, 2024. During this period, elite figure skaters will compete in various domestic and international events, including the Grand Prix series, Junior Grand Prix series, and the World Championships.

# Season Notes

## Age Eligibility

To be eligible to compete in junior-level events, skaters must be at least 13 but not yet 19 before July 1, 2023. For senior-level events, skaters must be at least 15 before July 1, 2023.

# Changes

## Partnership Changes

Several pairs and ice dance teams have announced changes to their partnerships for the 2023–24 season. One notable change is the split of reigning World silver medalists, Anastasia Mishina and Aleksandr Galliamov, who will skate with new partners this season.

## Retirements

Several notable figure skaters have announced their retirement from competitive figure skating. These include two-time Olympic silver medalist, Evgeniia Medvedeva, and 2018 World Champion, Nathan Chen.

## Coaching Changes

Several skaters have changed coaches for the 2023–24 season. Notably, 2022 World Champion, Shoma Uno, has switched coaches and will now train under renowned coach, Marin Honda.

## Nationality Changes

Several skaters have changed their national representation for the 2023–24 season. One notable change is the switch of 2020 World Junior Champion, Petr Gumennik, who will now represent the United States instead of Russia.

# International Competitions

## Cancelled

Due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, several international competitions have been cancelled for the 2023–24 season. These include the Asian Figure Skating Trophy and the ISU Challenger Series event, the Volvo Open Cup.

article:
Tropical Storm Alex (2022)

Tropical Storm Alex was a tropical cyclone that formed in the southeastern Gulf of Mexico in June 2022. The storm brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to several countries in the Caribbean, particularly Cuba, Florida, and the Bahamas. In this article, we will provide an overview of the meteorological history of Tropical Storm Alex, its impact on the affected areas, and the preparations made to mitigate its effects.

# Meteorological history

Tropical Storm Alex formed on June 2, 2022, as a tropical disturbance in the southeastern Gulf of Mexico. The system slowly organized over the next few days, with a low-pressure area developing on June 4. The National Hurricane Center (NHC) began monitoring the system on June 3, and by June 5, it had strengthened into a tropical depression. The depression gradually intensified, and on June 6, it became a tropical storm, earning the name Alex.

Alex moved north-northeastward, influenced by a mid-level trough over the eastern United States. The storm's maximum sustained winds increased to 65 mph (105 km/h) on June 7, and it began to exhibit characteristics of a subtropical cyclone. Alex's center passed over the western part of Cuba on June 8, bringing heavy rainfall and strong winds to the island.

After crossing Cuba, Alex moved into the Atlantic Ocean, where it encountered a more favorable environment for intensification. The storm's winds increased to 70 mph (115 km/h) on June 9, and it began to take on a more tropical appearance. However, Alex's intensification was short-lived, as it encountered increasing wind shear and dry air on June 10. The storm's winds gradually decreased, and it became a post-tropical cyclone on June 11.

# Preparations and impact

Tropical Storm Alex brought significant impacts to several countries in the Caribbean, particularly Cuba, Florida, and the Bahamas. In this section, we will provide an overview of the preparations made and the effects of the storm on these areas.

## Cuba

Cuba was the first country to be affected by Tropical Storm Alex. The storm's center passed over the western part of the island on June 8, bringing heavy rainfall and strong winds. The Cuban Meteorological Institute reported that the storm's maximum sustained winds reached 65 mph (105 km/h) in some areas, causing significant damage to buildings and infrastructure.

The Cuban government took extensive precautions to prepare for the storm, including evacuating over 50,000 people from low-lying areas and coastal regions. The government also closed schools, airports, and seaports, and suspended all outdoor activities.

Despite these preparations, the storm still caused significant damage to the island. The Cuban government reported that over 1,000 homes were damaged or destroyed, and several roads and bridges were affected. The storm also caused widespread power outages, leaving thousands of people without electricity.

## Florida

Tropical Storm Alex brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to southern Florida, particularly the Florida Keys. The storm's outer rain bands reached the state on June 9, causing flooding and power outages in some areas.

The National Weather Service issued a tropical storm watch for the Florida Keys and a flood watch for several counties in southern Florida. The Florida Emergency Management Division activated its emergency operations center to coordinate the state's response to the storm.

Despite the storm's impacts, no major damage or casualties were reported in Florida. The state's emergency management officials praised the public's preparedness and response to the storm, noting that many residents had taken precautions to secure their homes and property.

## The Bahamas

Tropical Storm Alex brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to the Bahamas, particularly the southern islands. The storm's center passed over the islands on June 10, causing significant flooding and damage to buildings and infrastructure.

The Bahamian government issued a tropical storm warning for the southern islands and a flood warning for several areas. The government also closed schools and airports, and suspended all outdoor activities.

Despite these precautions, the storm still caused significant damage to the islands. The Bahamian government reported that over 100 homes were damaged or destroyed, and several roads and bridges were affected. The storm also caused widespread power outages, leaving thousands of people without electricity.

The 2022 FIBA Under-17 Basketball World Cup was the fifth edition of the FIBA Under-17 Basketball World Cup, an international basketball competition organized by FIBA for national teams of young men aged 17 and under. The tournament was held in Malaga, Spain, from July 2 to July 10, 2022.

article:
The Menu (2022 film)

The Menu is a 2022 black comedy horror film directed by Mark Mylod and written by Seth Reiss and Will Tracy. The film stars Ralph Fiennes, Anya Taylor-Joy, Nicholas Hoult, and Hong Chau. It follows a young couple who travels to a remote island to dine at an exclusive restaurant, only to find themselves in a sinister and deadly game.

# Plot

The film takes place on a remote island, where a young couple, Tyler (Nicholas Hoult) and Margot (Anya Taylor-Joy), arrive to dine at the prestigious Hawthorne restaurant, run by the renowned Chef Julian Slowik (Ralph Fiennes). The restaurant is known for its unique and exclusive dining experience, with a price tag of $1,250 per head.

Upon arrival, the couple is greeted by the restaurant's staff, including the assistant manager, Elsa (Hong Chau), who explains the evening's menu and the rules of the restaurant. The couple is joined by other guests, including a wealthy couple, a food critic, and a middle-aged man, all of whom are eager to experience the chef's culinary expertise.

As the evening progresses, the guests begin to realize that something is amiss. The chef's dishes are not just exquisite, but also contain hidden messages and meanings that are slowly revealed throughout the meal. The guests soon find themselves in a sinister and deadly game, where they are forced to confront their own dark pasts and the true cost of their privilege.

# Cast

* Ralph Fiennes as Chef Julian Slowik
* Anya Taylor-Joy as Margot
* Nicholas Hoult as Tyler
* Hong Chau as Elsa
* Janet McTeer as Lillian Bloom
* Judith Light as Anne Leiberman
* Reed Birney as Richard Leiberman
* Paul Adelstein as Ted
* Rob Yang as Bryce
* Aimee Carrero as Felicity
* Arturo Castro as Soren
* Mark St. Cyr as Dave
* Rebecca Koon as Linda

# Production

## Development

The Menu was written by Seth Reiss and Will Tracy, who are both known for their work on the TV show Succession. The script was developed over several years, with the writers drawing inspiration from their own experiences with fine dining and the excesses of the wealthy.

The film was directed by Mark Mylod, who is known for his work on the TV show Game of Thrones. Mylod was attracted to the project because of its unique blend of horror and comedy, and he saw an opportunity to create a film that was both entertaining and thought-provoking.

## Casting

The cast of The Menu was announced in 2021, with Ralph Fiennes, Anya Taylor-Joy, and Nicholas Hoult all signing on to star in the film. The cast was drawn to the project because of its unique script and the opportunity to work with Mylod.

## Filming

Principal photography on The Menu took place in the spring of 2021, with filming locations including Savannah, Georgia, and the surrounding islands. The film was shot on a relatively modest budget, with a focus on practical effects and a small cast.

## Music

The score for The Menu was composed by Colin Stetson, who is known for his work on the TV show The Knick. The score is a key element of the film, with Stetson using a combination of orchestral and electronic elements to create a sense of tension and unease.

# Release

The Menu was released in the United States on November 18, 2022, by Searchlight Pictures. The film received a limited release, with a focus on art-house cinemas and film festivals.

# Reception

## Box office

The Menu was a commercial success, grossing over $40 million at the domestic box office and over $70 million worldwide. The film's success was driven by positive word-of-mouth and a strong marketing campaign.

## Critical response

The Menu received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's unique blend of horror and comedy. The film holds a 91% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising the performances of the cast and the direction of Mylod.

## Accolades

The Menu received several award nominations, including two Golden Globe nominations for Best Actor in a Motion Picture – Drama (Ralph Fiennes) and Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture (Anya Taylor-Joy). The film also received several Independent Spirit Award nominations, including Best Feature and Best Director.

# Notes

The Menu is a film that is both entertaining and thought-provoking, with a unique blend of horror and comedy that is sure to appeal to a wide range of audiences. With its talented cast and crew, the film is a must-see for anyone who loves cinema.

# References

article:
2022 Italian General Election

The 2022 Italian general election was held on 25 September 2022 to elect the members of the Chamber of Deputies and the Senate of the Republic, the two houses of the Italian Parliament. The election was called after the dissolution of the Parliament by President Sergio Mattarella, following the collapse of the Draghi government.

#Background

The 2022 Italian general election was the first national election to be held in Italy since the COVID-19 pandemic. The previous election, held in 2018, resulted in a hung parliament, with no party or coalition able to form a government. After several months of negotiations, a coalition government was formed between the Five Star Movement (M5S) and the League, led by Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte. However, the government collapsed in August 2022, after a vote of no confidence was passed by the Senate.

#Electoral Campaign

The electoral campaign for the 2022 Italian general election was marked by several key issues, including the economy, immigration, and the European Union. The main parties and coalitions presented their programs and candidates, and several electoral debates were held.

##Main Parties' Slogans

* Brothers of Italy: "Italy First"
* Democratic Party: "For a New Italy"
* Five Star Movement: "We Are the Change"
* Forza Italia: "With Berlusconi, Italy Will Rise Again"
* League: "We Will Make Italy Great Again"
* Action: "A New Generation for Italy"
* Italia Viva: "Italy Will Live"

##Electoral Debates

Several electoral debates were held during the campaign, featuring the leaders of the main parties and coalitions. The debates were broadcast on television and online, and were widely followed by the public.

#Electoral System

The Italian electoral system is a mixed system, combining elements of proportional representation and first-past-the-post (FPTP). The Chamber of Deputies is elected using a proportional system, with 37% of the seats allocated to the winning party or coalition, and the remaining seats allocated to the other parties and coalitions in proportion to their vote share. The Senate is elected using a mixed system, with 74% of the seats allocated using FPTP, and the remaining seats allocated using proportional representation.

#Electoral Lists

The electoral lists for the 2022 Italian general election were presented by the parties and coalitions in August 2022. The lists included the candidates for the Chamber of Deputies and the Senate, as well as the leaders of the parties and coalitions.

##Lists with Parliamentary Representation

* Brothers of Italy
* Democratic Party
* Five Star Movement
* Forza Italia
* League
* Action
* Italia Viva

##Lists without Parliamentary Representation

* Animalist Party
* Communist Party
* Italian Radicals
* South Tyrolean Freedom
* Union of the Centre

##Lists Running Only in Overseas Constituencies

* Associative Movement Italians Abroad
* Italians Abroad
* Movement of Italians Abroad

#Opinion Polls

The opinion polls for the 2022 Italian general election were published regularly during the campaign, and showed a consistent lead for the centre-right coalition, led by Brothers of Italy. The polls also showed a decline in support for the Five Star Movement, and a increase in support for the Democratic Party.

#Voter Turnout

The voter turnout for the 2022 Italian general election was 64.1%, a decrease of 9.1 percentage points compared to the 2018 election.

#Results

##Chamber of Deputies

* Centre-right coalition: 43.7%
* Centre-left coalition: 26.1%
* Five Star Movement: 15.4%
* Action - Italia Viva: 7.7%

* Proportional: Centre-right coalition 37.2%, Centre-left coalition 26.1%, Five Star Movement 15.4%
* FPTP: Centre-right coalition 51.6%, Centre-left coalition 26.5%, Five Star Movement 12.4%

###Overall Results

* Centre-right coalition: 44.0%
* Centre-left coalition: 25.4%

The Masked Singer (American TV series) season 9

Season 9 of the American television series The Masked Singer premiered on February 15, 2023, and concluded on May 17, 2023. The season featured a new group of celebrity contestants competing against each other, with one being eliminated each week.

# Panelists and host

The panelists for season 9 consisted of Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy Wahlberg, Nicole Scherzinger, and Robin Thicke. The host for the season was Nick Cannon.

# Production

Season 9 of The Masked Singer was produced by Fox Alternative Entertainment and Smart Dog Media. The show was filmed at CBS Studio Center in Los Angeles, California.

# Contestants

The contestants for season 9 were:

* Gargoyle
* Mustang
* Fairy
* Axolotl
* Polar Bear
* Viking
* Squirrel
* Jackalope
* Nightingale
* Medusa
* Doll
* Mantis
* Poodle
* Wolf

# Episodes

## Week 1 (February 15)

The season premiere featured the introduction of the new contestants and the first performances. Gargoyle, Mustang, and Fairy performed in the first group, while Axolotl, Polar Bear, and Viking performed in the second group. Squirrel, Jackalope, and Nightingale performed in the third group. Medusa was eliminated at the end of the episode.

## Week 2 (February 22) - "ABBA Night"

The second episode featured the contestants performing ABBA songs. Doll, Mantis, and Poodle performed in the first group, while Wolf, Squirrel, and Jackalope performed in the second group. The episode ended with the elimination of Axolotl.

## Week 3 (March 1) - "New York Night"

The third episode featured the contestants performing songs related to New York City. Viking, Nightingale, and Medusa performed in the first group, while Gargoyle, Mustang, and Fairy performed in the second group. The episode ended with the elimination of Polar Bear.

## Week 4 (March 8) - "DC Superheroes Night"

The fourth episode featured the contestants performing songs related to DC superheroes. Squirrel, Jackalope, and Wolf performed in the first group, while Doll, Mantis, and Poodle performed in the second group. The episode ended with the elimination of Viking.

## Week 5 (March 15) - "Sesame Street Night"

The fifth episode featured the contestants performing songs from Sesame Street. Nightingale, Medusa, and Fairy performed in the first group, while Gargoyle, Mustang, and Axolotl performed in the second group. The episode ended with the elimination of Squirrel.

## Week 6 (March 22) - "Country Night"

The sixth episode featured the contestants performing country songs. Jackalope, Wolf, and Poodle performed in the first group, while Doll, Mantis, and Mustang performed in the second group. The episode ended with the elimination of Nightingale.

## Week 7 (March 29) - "'80s Night"

The seventh episode featured the contestants performing songs from the 1980s. Gargoyle, Fairy, and Medusa performed in the first group, while Viking, Axolotl, and Polar Bear performed in the second group. The episode ended with the elimination of Jackalope.

## Week 8 (April 5) - "WB Movie Night"

The eighth episode featured the contestants performing songs from Warner Bros. movies. Wolf, Poodle, and Mantis performed in the first group, while Doll, Mustang, and Fairy performed in the second group. The episode ended with the elimination of Medusa.

## Week 9 (April 12) - "Masked Singer In Space"

The ninth episode featured the contestants performing space-themed songs. Gargoyle, Viking, and Axolotl performed in the first group, while Squirrel, Nightingale, and Polar Bear performed in the second group. The episode ended with the elimination of Poodle.

## Week 10 (April 19) - "Supreme Six"

The tenth episode featured the remaining six contestants performing. The episode ended with the elimination of Mantis.

## Week 11 (April 26) - "Battle of the Saved"

The eleventh episode featured the contestants competing against each other in duets. The episode ended with the elimination of Doll.

## Week 12 (May 3) - "Quarter Finals" (British Invasion Night)

The twelfth episode featured the contestants performing British Invasion songs. The episode ended with the elimination of Wolf.

## Week 13 (May 10) - "Semi-Finals"

The thirteenth episode featured the remaining four contestants performing. The episode ended with the elimination of Fairy and Mustang.

## Week 14 (May 17) - "Finale"

The season finale featured the remaining two contestants, Gargoyle and Nightingale, performing. Gargoyle was crowned the winner of season 9.

# Ratings

The season premiere was watched by 3.3 million viewers and had a 0.7 rating in the 18-49 demographic. The season finale was watched by 4.1 million viewers and had a 1.0 rating in the 18-49 demographic.

# Notes

Season 9 of The Masked Singer featured a new format, with the contestants competing in duets and groups. The season also featured a new theme each week, such as ABBA Night and DC Superheroes Night.
